description.narrative: Output 4.3. Child GovernanceBy 2020, an enabling environment for child rights governance that includes building the capacity of national institutions and civil society to advocate for children and advance child rights, while creatively designing avenues for children to participate in national policy discussions, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Protection â€“ General, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Education â€“ General, Health â€“ General, Hiv â€“ General, Human Rights Institutions, Nutrition â€“ General, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, improved equity-sensitive and child-friendly policies, programmes and budget allocations based on high-quality evidence and strengthened oversight

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.3. Child GovernanceBy 2020, an enabling environment for child rights governance that includes building the capacity ofnational institutions and civil society to advocate for children and advance child rights, while creatively designing avenues forchildren to participate in national policy discussions

description.narrative: UNICEF successfully collaborated with state and non-state actors across all sectors to ensure the progressive realization of children’s rights in Uganda. With the vision of achieving the meaningful participation of children, UNICEF worked with the government to submit the ACRWC Report to the African Union, develop and launch the child-friendly National Child Participation Strategy, and integrate the voices of children in the Child Rights TV Series, as well as VNR and SDG reporting. UNICEF Uganda also developed its first child-friendly version of the CDP for 2021–2025, to increase accountability with children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2021
